page.title: 13 HIGHCLIFFE JUNIOR SCHOOL
page.content: This school was opened in 1962. It is built of bricks with a tiled roof. In 1985 it had{307}children who were divided into nine classes. The main lessons given were Maths, English, Spelling, Topics (Geography, History, Nature), Singing and Craft. We use pencil or ballpoint pen mostly. The ages of the children range from{7-11 years old and all of them wear a special uniform. The girls' uniform is a green and white checked dress for summer and a grey skirt and white blouse for winter. The boys wear grey shorts and a white grey shirt.In the winter when we play sport it is usually netball or football and in summer it is rounders, cricket, long jump, stoolball and swimming. We do our activities and lessons in five and a half hours each day. By Clare Frew and Iona Dutton.
